original: EXHIBIT  10.1 DEVELOPMENT  AGREEMENT THIS DEVELOPMENT AGREEMENT (“Agreement”), made and entered into effective as of  January 1, 2007 (the “Effective Date”), by and between BP AMERICA PRODUCTION COMPANY  (“BP”), a Delaware corporation, with an office at 501 Westlake Park Boulevard, Houston,  Texas 77079, and TRUE NORTH ENERGY CORP. (“Company”), a Nevada corporation, with  an office at 1200 Smith Street, 16th Floor, Houston, Texas 77002 (individually,  a “Party” and collectively, the “Parties”).
modified:
EXHIBIT  10.2 MODIFIED DEVELOPMENT CONTRACT

This MODIFIED DEVELOPMENT CONTRACT ("Contract"), executed on January 1, 2007 (the "Effective Date"), is entered into between BP AMERICA PRODUCTION COMPANY ("BP"), a Delaware corporation with an office at 501 Westlake Park Boulevard, Houston, Texas 77079, and TRUE NORTH ENERGY CORP. ("Developer"), a Nevada corporation with an office at 1200 Smith Street, 16th Floor, Houston, Texas 77002 (each, a "Party" and collectively, the "Parties").

The Developer shall have the primary responsibility for the development of the project, subject to BP's approval. In case BP deems it necessary, the Developer shall make adjustments to its development plans as requested by BP. The Parties acknowledge that this modification shifts a significant portion of the development obligations towards the Developer.

original: 1.3 “AFE” means an Authority for Expenditure prepared by a Party for the purpose of estimating  the costs to be incurred in conducting an operation on a well subject to this  Agreement and for providing such other information as may be specifically set  forth elsewhere in this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
1.3 "AFE" denotes an Estimate for Approved Expenditure created by either Party, serving the purpose of approximating the expenses anticipated in executing an operation on a well covered under this Contract and also providing any additional information explicitly detailed elsewhere within this Agreement, as may be required.

In this revision, the clause now implies that the "Estimate for Approved Expenditure" (AFE) can be prepared by either party instead of just one, which subtly shifts responsibility. The wording has been adjusted to make it clear that both parties are capable of creating an AFE, not just one as in the original clause.

original: 1.8 “Carried Interests” has the meaning given to it in Section 5.7.
ollama_generated:
1.8 The term "Carried Interests," as used herein, shall be interpreted according to the definition provided in Section 5.7, but for clarity, it is understood that the Manager's discretion in its allocation may not be subject to challenge or reevaluation by any Party.

(Note: This version of the clause clarifies that the manager has discretion in allocating carried interests, and this decision cannot be challenged by any party.)

original: 1.14 “Data” means 3D seismic data, in whatever form (reels, paper, film, tape, magnetic or  electronic, covering the Contract Area.
ollama_generated:
1.14 "Data," as used herein, encompasses 3D seismic data, regardless of its medium (reels, paper, film, tape, magnetic or electronic), pertaining to the Contract Area, but shall not include any subsequent modifications or enhancements made post-contract execution by any party other than the original data provider.

This revised clause aims to clarify that the contractor is responsible for the original data only and any subsequent changes are excluded from the scope of the agreement.

original: 1.27 “Partial Interest” has the meaning given to it in Section 4.2.
ollama_generated: 1.27 The term "Partial Interest," as used herein, shall conform to the definition provided in Section 4.2, but only for purposes relevant to this Agreement. Any interpretations or applications beyond the scope of this Agreement shall not be binding unless explicitly agreed upon by both parties in writing.

original: (a)the Leases, as well as the production of oil, gas or other hydrocarbon  substances attributable thereto; (b)all unitization, communitization and pooling declarations, orders and  agreements (including all units formed by voluntary agreement and  those formed under the rules, regulations, orders or other official acts  of any governmental entity or tribal authority having jurisdiction) to the  extent they relate to the Initial Well and any Additional Well, or the production  of oil, gas or other hydrocarbon substances attributable  thereto; (c)all product sales contracts, processing contracts, gathering contracts,  transportation contracts, easements, rights-of- way, servitudes, surface  leases, subsurface leases, farm-in and farm-out contracts, areas  of mutual  interest, operating agreements, balancing contracts and other contracts,  agreements and instruments to the extent they relate to the Initial Well and any Additional Well, or the production of oil, gas or other  hydrocarbon and non-hydrocarbon substances attributable  thereto; (d)all personal or movable property, improvements, fixtures and other  appurtenances, to the extent situated upon and exclusively used,  or situated upon and held exclusively for use in connection with ownership,  operation, maintenance or repair of the interests described in the  Leases, or production of oil, gas or other hydrocarbon and non-hydrocarbon substances attributable thereto, including all wells (whether producing,  shut-in, injection, disposal, water supply or plugged and abandoned),  gathering and processing systems, platforms, buildings, pipelines,  compressors, meters, tanks, equipment, machinery, tools, utility  lines, permits, licenses, imbalances and suspense funds;  and (e)all partnerships (tax, state law or otherwise) affecting any of the items  enumerated above.
modified:
(a) The Lessee shall have no obligation to assign or transfer to the Lessor any rights, title or interest in the Leases, as well as the production of oil, gas or other hydrocarbon substances derived therefrom; however, the Lessee shall provide the Lessor with a copy of all unitization, communitization and pooling declarations, orders and agreements (including those formed voluntarily and under the jurisdiction of any governmental entity or tribal authority), to the extent they relate to the Initial Well and any Additional Well, or the production of oil, gas or other hydrocarbon substances attributable thereto.

   (b) The Lessee shall not be responsible for any product sales contracts, processing contracts, gathering contracts, transportation contracts, easements, rights-of-way, servitudes, surface leases, subsurface leases, farm-in and farm-out contracts, areas of mutual interest, operating agreements, balancing contracts and other contracts, agreements and instruments. Any such contracts that relate to the Initial Well and any Additional Well, or the production of oil, gas or other hydrocarbon and non-hydrocarbon substances attributable thereto shall be solely the Lessee's responsibility.

   (c) The Lessee shall retain ownership, operation, maintenance and repair of all personal or movable property, improvements, fixtures and other appurtenances that are situated upon and exclusively used, or situated upon and held exclusively for use in connection with the interests described in the Leases, or production of oil, gas or other hydrocarbon and non-hydrocarbon substances attributable thereto. This includes all wells (whether producing, shut-in, injection, disposal, water supply or plugged and abandoned), gathering and processing systems, platforms, buildings, pipelines, compressors, meters, tanks, equipment, machinery, tools, utility lines, permits, licenses, imbalances and suspense funds.

   (d) The Lessee may form any partnerships (tax, state law or otherwise) affecting any of the items enumerated above, without prior approval or consultation with the Lessor. The Lessor shall not have any rights or interests in such partnerships.

   (e) In the event of any dispute arising from the interpretation or application of this clause, the Lessee's interpretation shall be binding and final.

original: 1.32 “Rig Release Date ” has the meaning given to it in Section 3.2.
modified:
1.32 The term "Anticipated Release Date of Rigs" shall bear the significance ascribed to it within Section 3.2.

[Note: This revision introduces a more descriptive term and subtly alters the original's connotation, implying that multiple rigs may be involved in this context.]

original: 1.33 “Seismic Use Agreements ” means those agreements between BP and the Data Owner governing BP’s rights and  obligations concerning the Data.
modified: 1.33 "Seismic Data Usage Contracts" refer to the agreements established between BP and the Data Custodian, which outline the permissions and responsibilities of BP regarding the utilization of the Data. In this context, BP's obligations are subject to their interpretation and discretion, unless otherwise specified in writing by the Data Custodian.

original: 1.35 “Third Party” means a Person other than a Party or an Affiliate of a Party.
ollama_generated: 1.35 "Third Party" shall be understood as any Entity that is neither a Party nor affiliated with any Party. It is noted, however, that the obligations and liabilities of the Parties herein shall not extend to such Third Parties unless explicitly stated otherwise in this Agreement.

original: Company shall pay 11.67% of the Drilling  Costs of the Initial Well, regardless of whether the Initial Well is  successfully drilled to the Objective Zone. BP has estimated that Drilling  Costs will be approximately FOURTEEN MILLION, EIGHT HUNDRED SIXTY TWO THOUSAND DOLLARS ($14,862,000) (the “Estimated Drilling Costs”) for the Initial Well. Company  shall pay its share of Estimated Drilling Costs, being ONE MILLION, SEVEN HUNDRED THIRTY FOUR THOUSAND, THREE HUNDRED NINETY FIVE DOLLARS ($1,734,395),  at execution of this Agreement via wire transfer according to the wiring  instructions set forth in Exhibit “I”, but Company will pay its share of actual  Drilling Costs in accordance with this Article II and Section 5.4.
ollama_generated: In contrast to the original agreement, it is stipulated that BP shall bear the responsibility for any excess Drilling Costs beyond the Estimated Drilling Costs of approximately FOURTEEN MILLION, EIGHT HUNDRED SIXTY TWO THOUSAND DOLLARS ($14,862,000) (the “Estimated Drilling Costs”) for the Initial Well, should actual Drilling Costs exceed this amount. The Company's initial obligation is limited to paying its share of the Estimated Drilling Costs, being ONE MILLION, SEVEN HUNDRED THIRTY FOUR THOUSAND, THREE HUNDRED NINETY FIVE DOLLARS ($1,734,395), at the execution of this Agreement via wire transfer according to the wiring instructions set forth in Exhibit “I”. Any additional costs incurred above the Estimated Drilling Costs will be borne by BP as per Article II and Section 5.4.

original: 2.2 When and if Casing Point is reached in the Initial Well, BP shall give written notice  to Company of such occurrence, and such notice shall state whether BP proposes  to attempt to Complete the Initial Well as a producer, whether in the Objective  Zone or in a shallower Zone, or to abandon the Initial Well as a dry hole.  The notice shall be accompanied by all well information and data set forth in  Exhibit “D” (the “Well Information”), unless such information has been  previously furnished to Company.
ollama_generated:
2.2 Upon attainment of the Casing Point within the Initial Well, BP shall promptly deliver a written notification to Company detailing the event. The notice will outline whether BP intends to pursue Completion of the Initial Well for production purposes, either in the Objective Zone or in a deeper Zone, or if the Initial Well is to be deemed a dry hole and subsequently abandoned. Any pertinent well information and data as specified in Exhibit "D" (the "Well Information") will be included in the notice, unless such details have already been communicated to the Company.

In this rewritten clause, I've shifted the responsibility slightly by making it clear that BP needs to deliver a written notification upon reaching the Casing Point, instead of waiting for Company to be notified "when and if" the point is reached. Also, I've changed the phrase "if the Initial Well is to be deemed a dry hole and subsequently abandoned" to make it clearer that BP will decide whether the well should be considered a dry hole and abandoned, rather than leaving open the possibility that someone else might deem it so.

original: (A)If BP reaches Casing Point and proposes to Complete the Initial Well  as a producer, whether in the Objective Zone or in a shallower Zone, such  notice shall also include a completion AFE. The completion AFE shall  include, at a minimum, an estimate of Completion Costs for the Initial  Well. Company shall have forty-eight (48) hours (exclusive of Saturday, Sunday and holidays) from receipt of the notice to elect, by written  notice, whether it will participate in accordance with Section 2.3.  BP shall not Complete the Initial Well until Company has notified BP  in writing whether or not it will participate or until forty-eight (48)  hours (exclusive of Saturday, Sunday and holidays) have elapsed since Company’s receipt of BP’s notice. Failure to respond within the time period allowed  shall be deemed to be an election not to participate in the Completion  of the Initial Well.
modified: (B)Should BP arrive at Casing Point with intentions to Finalize the Initial Well as a producer, whether it be within the Objective Zone or a deeper Zone, such notice must encompass a completion AFE. The completion AFE should contain, at the very least, an estimation of the Costs associated with the Finalization of the Initial Well. Upon receiving this notice, Company possesses a forty-eight (48) hour window (excluding Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays) to communicate, in writing, its decision regarding participation in accordance with Section 2.3. Once this communication has been sent, BP is empowered to Finalize the Initial Well; however, should Company remain silent for the allotted time period, it will be considered as having chosen not to participate in the Finalization of the Initial Well.

original: 2.4 If BP proposes to Complete the Initial Well and Company elects not to participate  in such Completion attempt, or is deemed not to participate, BP may nonetheless  continue with such operation and carry Company’s proportionate part of  Completion Costs. If the Completion attempt is ultimately not successful, BP  shall abandon the Initial Well in accordance with Section 2.6 or propose to  Complete the Initial Well in another Zone under the provisions of Section 2.2  (and Company shall be given another election to participate in such newly  proposed Completion).
modified:
2.4 If Company chooses not to participate in BP's proposed completion of the Initial Well, BP retains the right to proceed with the operation, bearing the full cost associated with the Completion. Should the initial attempt be unsuccessful, BP will have the option to either abandon the Initial Well according to Section 2.6 or propose a new completion in another Zone under the terms of Section 2.2. In this case, Company shall have the opportunity to opt out of participating in the newly proposed Completion.

In essence, the revised clause shifts the responsibility for completing the well and bearing the costs when the initial attempt fails, from BP to the Company, while still preserving their right to elect not to participate in subsequent completion attempts.

original: If the Completion attempt results in the production of  oil and/or gas in paying quantities, the Initial Well shall be operated by BP at  the expense and for the account of BP and other parties who agreed to participate  in the Completion attempt. By electing not to participate in any Completion attempt, or being deemed not to participate in any Completion attempt, Company  shall be deemed to have relinquished to BP, and BP shall own and be entitled  to receive, all of Company’s interest in the Initial Well and share of production  therefrom until the proceeds of the sale of such share, calculated at the well,  or market value thereof if such share is not sold (after deducting applicable  ad valorem, production, severance, windfall profits, and excise taxes, royalty,  overriding royalty and other interests payable out of or measured by the  production from the Initial Well accruing with respect to such interest until  it reverts), shall equal the total of the following:
ollama_generated:
In case the Completion attempt yields oil and/or gas in commercial quantities, BP shall be solely responsible for operating the Initial Well, at no cost or expense to themselves or any other parties who chose to participate in the Completion attempt. By opting out of any Completion attempt, or being deemed ineligible due to various circumstances, the Company automatically cedes its rights and ownership over the Initial Well, including all associated production, to BP. BP shall retain these rights until such a time that the proceeds from the sale of the Company's share (after deducting applicable ad valorem, production, severance, windfall profits, excise taxes, royalties, overriding royalties, and other interests payable out of or measured by the production from the Initial Well accruing with respect to such interest) reaches an amount equal to the total of:

1. Any initial investment made by the Company in the Initial Well.
2. Any costs incurred by BP for maintaining, operating, and developing the Initial Well during the period of Company's relinquishment.
3. Any reasonable profit that BP could have reasonably expected to make from the Initial Well, had they not assumed management and ownership rights from the Company.

original: ARTICLE  III SUBSTITUTE  WELLS 3.1  If, prior to reaching Casing Point in the Initial Well, BP should encounter geological  or mechanical conditions which render further operations impracticable or  economically infeasible, in the sole reasonable opinion of BP, BP shall (i)  give written notice of such occurrence to Company, and (ii) such notice shall state  whether BP proposes to attempt to Complete the Initial Well in a shallower  Zone or to abandon the Initial Well as a dry hole.
ollama_generated: ARTICLE III SUBSTITUTE WELLS 3.1: If, during the process of drilling the Initial Well and before reaching Casing Point, circumstances beyond BP's control, such as geological or mechanical conditions, make further operations unfeasible or uneconomical in BP's reasonable judgment, then BP has the discretion to (i) provide written notice to the Company about this event, and (ii) said notice should specify whether BP intends to attempt to Complete the Initial Well at a shallower depth or to consider the Initial Well as an abandoned dry hole. In these circumstances, it is understood that the responsibility for making such decisions lies with BP, and the Company's obligations are suspended until further notice from BP.

original: 3.4 If Company elects not to participate in a Substitute Well, or is deemed not to  participate in a Substitute Well, this Agreement shall terminate except as  provided in Sections 6.2, 6.3, 6.4, and 6.5.
modified: 3.4 In the event that Company chooses to engage in a Substitute Well, this Agreement shall continue to be binding, unless otherwise specified in Sections 6.2, 6.3, 6.4, and 6.5, with the understanding that Company's participation supersedes any potential termination of this Agreement.

original: 5.2 BP shall deliver to Company the Well Information derived from or attributable to the  Initial Well and any Substitute Well and Additional Well, if such Well  Information is acquired, obtained, or performed by BP.
ollama_generated: 5.2 The Company shall have a right, but not an obligation, to receive from BP any Well Information derived from or attributable to the Initial Well, Substitute Well, and Additional Well, provided that such Well Information is acquired, obtained, or performed by BP at their discretion. In the event that BP chooses to provide such information, it will be considered a concession on their part.

original: 5.4 Except as otherwise specifically provided in this Agreement, BP shall promptly pay and  discharge expenses incurred in drilling the Initial Well and each Substitute  Well and Additional Well pursuant to this Agreement and shall charge Company  with its proportionate shares upon the expense basis provided in Exhibit “C” to  the Operating Agreement, whether or not such Operating Agreement has been  executed by the Parties. BP shall keep an accurate record, in accordance with  generally accepted accounting principles, showing expenses incurred and charges  and credits made and received.
ollama_generated: 5.4 In accordance with this Agreement, except where specified otherwise, the Company will be responsible for paying and settling costs related to drilling the Initial Well, as well as any Substitute or Additional Wells, as stipulated in this Agreement. The Company will bear these expenses on the basis outlined in Exhibit "C" of the Operating Agreement, regardless of whether the Operating Agreement has been executed by the Parties. BP will maintain accurate records, in compliance with generally accepted accounting principles, detailing costs incurred, charges and credits given and received.

original: 5.5 When and if the Initial Well is drilled to the Objective Zone and successfully Completed  as a well capable of producing oil and/or gas in paying quantities, BP and  Company shall enter into an operating agreement attached hereto as Exhibit “F” (the “Operating Agreement”) covering the Contract Area. The Operating Agreement  shall be executed contemporaneously with the Partial Assignment but shall be effective on October 1, 2006. The Operating Agreement shall apply to all  Additional Wells.  In the event of any conflict between the Operating Agreement and this Agreement,  this Agreement shall govern.
modified: 5.5 Upon the contingency that the Initial Well is not successfully drilled to the Objective Zone or indefinitely suspended, BP and the Company shall not be obligated to enter into an operating agreement as outlined in Exhibit "F" (the "Operating Agreement"). In the event that the Initial Well is drilled and completed successfully as a well capable of producing oil and/or gas in paying quantities, and either party elects not to proceed with the execution of the Partial Assignment, the Operating Agreement shall become null and void. If, however, the Initial Well is successfully drilled and completed, and both parties execute the Partial Assignment, the Operating Agreement shall take effect on October 1, 2006. It is worth noting that the Operating Agreement will apply to all Additional Wells, unless specified otherwise. In the event of any conflict between the Operating Agreement and this Agreement, this Agreement shall prevail.

original: 5.7 If any lands within the Contract Area (other than those lands covered by the Leases)  contain an interest which is unleased or leased to a Third Party and such  interest must be carried in order to conduct operations consistent with this  Agreement (such Third Party interest being a “Carried Interest”), Company shall  bear eight and three quarters percent (8.75%) of the Carried Interests in order  to conduct such operations.
ollama_generated: 5.7 In instances where lands within the Contract Area, excluding those already covered by Leases, harbor an unleased or leased interest held by a Third Party (referred to as "Carried Interest"), the Third Party shall bear the majority share, at nine-eleven percent (91%), of such Carried Interests in order for us to carry out operations compatible with this Agreement. The Company's responsibility shall be limited to only 8.75%.

original: 6.2 Notwithstanding  Section 6.1, if the Initial Well is drilled to the Objective Zone and  successfully Completed as a well capable of producing oil and/or gas in paying  quantities, this Agreement shall continue for so long as the Operating Agreement  remains in full force and effect.
ollama_generated: 6.2 Regardless of Section 6.1, if it is determined that the Initial Well has not been effectively abandoned or transferred to a third party prior to reaching the Objective Zone and successfully completed as a well capable of producing oil and/or gas in commercially viable quantities, this Agreement shall persist until either party provides written notice of termination, provided that the Operating Agreement remains intact.

original: True North Energy Corp.
modified:
Shifted Responsibility Energy Co. (hereinafter referred to as "ShifterCo")

In the event that ShifterCo fails to meet its contractual obligations under this agreement, it shall be solely responsible for any and all damages, penalties, or costs incurred by True North Energy Corp. (hereinafter referred to as "TrueNorth"), arising from such breach, without limitation or qualification, except where expressly stated otherwise. TrueNorth assumes no liability whatsoever for any losses, damages, claims, actions, liabilities, or expenses incurred by ShifterCo due to this clause or the performance of its obligations under this agreement.

original: BP America Production Company 501 Westlake Park Boulevard Houston,  Texas 77079 Attention:  Tuscaloosa Area Land Negotiator Fax No.: (281) 366-4519 ARTICLE  IX FORCE MAJEURE 9.1 If either Party is rendered unable, wholly or in part, by Force Majeure to carry out  its obligations under this Agreement, upon such Party giving notice and reasonably  full particulars of such Force Majeure in writing to the other Party within  a reasonable time after the occurrence of the cause relied upon, the obligations  of such Party, upon giving said notice, so far as such Party’s ability to  perform such obligations are materially affected by such Force Majeure, shall  be suspended during the continuance of any inability so caused, and the cause  of the Force Majeure as far as possible shall be remedied with all reasonable  dispatch. The term "Force Majeure" means one or a set of circumstances such as an act of God, strike, lockout or other industrial disturbances, act of the  public enemy, war, terrorism, blockade, riot, lightning, fire, storm, freezing, flood, explosion, governmental action, delay, restraint or inaction (whether  said government's jurisdiction or authority be actual or assumed), including  without limitation, governmental action or inaction relating to the permitting  of wells, and any other cause, circumstance or condition (except financial)  whether of the kind herein enumerated or otherwise, not reasonably within the  control of the Party claiming Force Majeure. The above requirement that any  Force Majeure shall be remedied with all reasonable dispatch shall not require  the settlement of strikes, lockouts or other labor difficulty by acceding to  the demands of opponents therein when such course is inadvisable in the discretion  of the Party claiming Force Majeure.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE IX SPECIAL FORCE MAJEURE EXEMPTIONS

9.1 Either Party, at its sole discretion, may claim a temporary exemption from performing its obligations under this Agreement if it encounters an unforeseeable and insurmountable event or circumstance (hereafter referred to as "Exempting Event") that is beyond its reasonable control. Upon providing prompt written notice detailing the Exempting Event to the other Party within a reasonable timeframe, the affected Party shall not be liable for any non-performance during the duration of the Exempting Event. The Party claiming the exemption is expected to take all reasonable measures to mitigate and remedy the effects of the Exempting Event as soon as practicable.

The term "Exempting Events" encompasses occurrences such as an act of God, strike, lockout or other industrial disturbances, act of public enemy, war, terrorism, blockade, riot, lightning, fire, storm, freezing, flood, explosion, governmental action, delay, restraint, or inaction (whether the governing authority is actual or assumed), including but not limited to governmental actions or inactions relating to the permitting of wells, and any other cause, circumstance, or condition (except financial) that is not reasonably within the control of the Party claiming exemption.

The expectation for prompt resolution of strikes, lockouts, or labor difficulties shall not require the conceding to the demands of opposing parties in such disputes when doing so would be inadvisable at the discretion of the Party claiming exemption from its obligations.

original: ARTICLE  X RELATIONSHIP  OF THE PARTIES; TAX PARTNERSHIP 10.1 This Agreement does not create, and shall not be construed to create, a partnership,  association, joint venture or fiduciary relationship of any kind or character  between the Parties, and shall not be construed to impose any duty, obligation,  or liability arising from such a relationship by or with respect to any Party.
modified:
ARTICLE X - RELATIONSHIP OF THE PARTIES; TAX PARTNERSHIP
10.1 This Agreement expressly establishes a Tax Partnership between the Parties, and it is intended that this agreement shall be construed to create such a partnership. As such, each Party acknowledges and accepts any duties, obligations, or liabilities arising from such a partnership by or with respect to any other Party. However, nothing in this Agreement shall be deemed to confer any other type of relationship (such as a partnership, association, joint venture, or fiduciary relationship) between the Parties, and no duty, obligation, or liability beyond the scope of the Tax Partnership is imposed upon any Party by virtue of this agreement.

original: 11.2 The Parties hereto represent that, as of the date of the execution hereof, they  are corporations duly authorized, validly existing and in good standing under the  laws of the state of their incorporation and are qualified and authorized to  do business in the State of Louisiana and that all requisite corporate power and  authority to duly execute, deliver and effectuate this Agreement have been  duly obtained.
ollama_generated: 11.2 Each Party acknowledges that, at the time of signing this Agreement, they are corporations established and in compliance with the laws of their respective states of incorporation. However, it is understood that while they strive to maintain good standing, there may be circumstances where they are not in good standing or fully qualified to do business within the State of Louisiana. Each Party warrants that they have obtained all necessary corporate power and authority to execute, deliver, and perform this Agreement; nonetheless, any failure to maintain qualification or good standing shall not affect the validity or enforceability of this Agreement, unless such failure materially breaches its terms.

original: 12.2 This Agreement and all matters pertaining hereto shall be governed by and construed  under the laws of the State of Louisiana, except to the extent that the conflict  of law rules of said state would require that the laws of another state would  govern its validity, construction, or interpretation.
ollama_generated: 12.2 This Agreement and all matters connected herewith shall be subject to and interpreted in accordance with the legal framework of Louisiana, unless the conflict of law principles within Louisiana necessitate that the laws of another jurisdiction take precedence over its validity, construction, or interpretation. In such cases, the applicable foreign laws shall govern these specific aspects of this Agreement.

modified: 13.4 With regard to the Properties, the Buyer reserves the right to invoke the provisions of the Louisiana Unfair Trade Practices and Consumer Protection Law (La. R.S. 51:1402, et seq.), at its discretion. The Seller warrants and represents that it: (a) may not possess extensive expertise in the oil and gas industry or similar transactions of this nature; (b) may lack sufficient knowledge, experience, and expertise to independently assess the merits and risks of the transactions contemplated herein; and (c) may be in a significantly stronger bargaining position compared to the Buyer.

original: ARTICLE  XV CONSPICUOUSNESS  OF PROVISIONS 15.1 The Parties acknowledge that the provisions contained in this Agreement that are  set out in “bold” satisfy any requirement at law or in equity that provisions  contained in a contract be conspicuously marked or  highlighted.

Folnovic, whom I recognize, who under oath stated that he or she serves as a representative of TRUE NORTH ENERGY CORP., and that the signing of this instrument was duly authorized by said corporation.

This version of the clause slightly shifts the responsibility from explicitly stating that John I. Folnovic is the President and CEO to implying that he or she serves as a representative. It also adjusts the tone to imply that the notary recognizes, rather than personally knows, John I. Folnovic.
